pop_finder.hp_tuning module¶

class pop_finder.hp_tuning.classifierHyperModel(input_shape, num_classes)[source]¶

Bases: kerastuner.engine.hypermodel.HyperModel

build(hp)[source]¶

Builds a model with the specified hyperparameters.

Parameters

hp (keras.tuners class) – Class that defines how to sample hyperparameters (e.g. RandomSearch()).

Returns

model – Model with all the layers and specified hyperparameters.

Return type

Keras sequential model

pop_finder.pop_finder module¶

pop_finder.read module¶

pop_finder.read.read_data(infile, sample_data, save_allele_counts, kfcv=False)[source]¶

Reads a .zarr, .vcf, or h5py file containing genetic data and creates subsettable data for a classifier neural network.

Parameters

  • infile (string) – Path to the .zarr, .vcf, or h5py file.

  • sample_data (string) – Path to .txt file containing sample information (columns are x, y, sampleID, and pop).

  • save_allele_counts (boolean) – Saves derived allele count information (Default=False).

  • kfcv (boolean) – If being used to test accuracy with k-fold cross- validation (i.e. no NAs in the sample data), set to True (Default=False).

Returns

  • samp_list (dataframe) – Contains information on corresponding sampleID and population classifications.

  • dc (np.array) – Array of derived allele counts.

  • unknowns (dataframe) – If kfcv is set to False, returns a dataframe with information about sampleID and indices for samples of unknown origin.
